lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Command to mark a task done.
* Command to mark a task undone.
* Command to add a new todo.
* Command to add a new deadline.
* Command to add a new event.
* Command to find tasks that contains given String.
* The main class for the Duke task management application.
* Constructor for Duke, which instantiates the storage and taskList.
* @param filePath The specified filePath of the database.
* Listens for user input and processes commands until the user exits.
return super.toString() + "There are invalid entries in your database ! :-(\n";
return super.toString() + "Your start date cannot be after your end date :-(\n";
* The base abstract class for custom exceptions.
public abstract class DukeException extends Exception {
* Returns a common error message for Duke exceptions.
* @return A String representation of the error message.
return super.toString() + "Please enter a date of format yyyy-mm-dd eg: 2023-09-26 :-(\n";
return super.toString() + "I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n";
* Parses user input and database entries.
* Parses a database entry and extracts relevant information.
* @param entry The database entry to be parsed.
* @return An ArrayList containing the elements extracted from the database entry.
* @throws DukeDatabaseInvalidEntryException If the database entry format is invalid.
public static ArrayList<String> parseDatabaseEntry(String entry) throws DukeDatabaseInvalidEntryException {
* Parses a Command from the given input String.
* @return The Command enum value corresponding to the parsed command.
* @throws DukeNoSuchCommandException If the input does not correspond to a known Command.
public static Command parseCommand(String input) throws DukeNoSuchCommandException {
* Parses user input and extracts relevant information.
* @param input The user input String to be parsed.
* @return An ArrayList containing the elements extracted from the user input String.
* @throws DukeInvalidArgumentException If the input does not correspond to a known Command.
public static ArrayList<String> parseUserInput(String input) throws DukeInvalidArgumentException {
* Handles the loading and storing of tasks from and to the data file.
* Constructor for Storage with specified filepath.
* @param filepath The filepath where the data is stored.
* Loads task data from the data file.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the data file.
* @throws DukeDatabaseNotFoundException If the data file is not found.
* Saves the TaskList to the data file.
* @param taskList The TaskList containing the tasks.
private Task readEntry(ArrayList<String> parsedEntry) throws DukeDatabaseInvalidEntryException,
throw new IOException("Failed to create data directory");
throw new IOException("Failed to create duke file");
private void writeTaskListToFile(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
* Converts a date string in "MMM dd yyyy" format (eg: Oct 15 2019) to LocalDate.
* @param inputDate The date string in "MMM dd yyyy" format.
* @return The LocalDate representation of the input date.
return LocalDate.parse(inputDate, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy", Locale.ENGLISH));
* @param by Deadline date in MMM DD YYYY format.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline.
* @return string representation of the Deadline task.
* @param start Start date in MMM DD YYYY format.
* @param end End date in MMM DD YYYY format.
* @throws DukeEndDateBeforeStartDateException If the end date is before the start date.
public Event(String description, LocalDate start,LocalDate end) throws DukeEndDateBeforeStartDateException {
* Returns a string representation of the Event.
* @return string representation of the Event task.
* The abstract base class for tasks.
* @param description A String describing the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the Task.
* Constructs a TaskList with the given list of tasks.
* @param taskList An ArrayList of tasks to initialise the TaskList.
* Adds a new Todo task to the TaskList.
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the user input is missing task description.
public void newTodo(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeMissingArgumentException {
* Adds a new Deadline task to the TaskList.
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the user input is missing task description or /by date.
* @throws DukeInvalidDateFormatException If the date format in the user input is invalid.
public void newDeadline(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeMissingArgumentException,
* Adds a new Event task to the TaskList.
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the user input is missing task description or /from date or /to date.
* @throws DukeInvalidDateFormatException If the date format in the user input is invalid.
* @throws DukeEndDateBeforeStartDateException If the end date is before the start date.
public void newEvent(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeMissingArgumentException,
* Lists all the tasks in the TaskList.
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeNoTaskFoundException If the specified task index is out of range.
* @throws DukeInvalidArgumentException If the input for task index is not an integer.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the input is missing the task index.
public void markAsDone(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeNoTaskFoundException,
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeNoTaskFoundException If the specified task index is out of range.
* @throws DukeInvalidArgumentException If the input for task index is not an integer.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the input is missing the task index.
public void markAsUndone(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeNoTaskFoundException,
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeNoTaskFoundException If the specified task index is out of range.
* @throws DukeInvalidArgumentException If the input for task index is not an integer.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the input is missing the task index.
public void delete(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeNoTaskFoundException,
* Finds all the task that matches a target String.
* @param parsedInput An ArrayList containing the parsed user input.
* @throws DukeMissingArgumentException If the input is missing the target String.
public void find(ArrayList<String> parsedInput) throws DukeMissingArgumentException {

"Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"

"3. mark <taskNumber> - Mark a task as done",

"10. find <keyword> - Search for tasks with a keyword"
* Displays a message indicating the successful addition of a Todo task.

"Now you have " + size + " task" + (size <= 1 ? "" : "s") + " in the list."

"Got it. I've added this deadline task:",

"Nice! I've marked this task as done:",

* @param task The task that was marked undone.
"OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:",

* Displays a message of the taskList indexed starting from 1.

Deadline task = new Deadline("CS2103T ip", LocalDate.parse("2023-08-12"));
Deadline task = new Deadline("CS2103T ip", LocalDate.parse("2023-08-12"));
Deadline task = new Deadline("CS2103T ip", LocalDate.parse("2023-08-12"));

assertEquals(task.toString(), "[E][ ] career fair (from: Aug 10 2023 to: Aug 11 2023)");
assertEquals(e.toString(), "OOPS!!! Your start date cannot be after your end date :-(\n");
